title: It's the holidays, you know
body:
Things have cooled down quite a bit around here as of late. I've seen a drastic dip in the Moxie Blog's readership over the last week or so, which I'm attributing to the fact that it's the holidays... I hope. SO, for the last few posts of the year, I'm going to let my hair down (all 1.64 inches of it) and talk about stuff that has nothing to do with the Moxie or any of its affiliates. Let's see, what to talk about... what to talk about... ah ha! I've been seeing a lot of "Year In Review" articles lately, so maybe I'll take a moment to write one of my own. Don't worry, I'm not in the mood to write a novel of a post today, so it won't be THAT bad. I should note, I've never been one for "best of" lists. If you ask me what my favorite movie is, I won't tell you, because, frankly, I don't know. When it comes to things I like, I tend to mentally glob them together into groups with no particular order (i.e. my 10 favorite movies, my 8 favorite carpet piles, etc.). Not much more to say about that. Let's get crackin'. MOVIES I ENJOYED IN 2004 Nicole and I were very frugal this past year, so we didn't get to see near as many movies as we would've liked. I'm sure this list will be much bigger in 2005.
  • Shaun of the Dead - If I had to choose one, I'd say this was probably the best movie that I saw in 2004.
  • Garden State - Natalie Portman, Zach Braff, Natalie Portman, Peter Sarsgaard, and Natalie Portman. What's not to like?
  • Napoleon Dynamite - What can I say, it grew on me. It's still fairly plotless though.
  • The Bourne Supremacy - I'm a fan of any movie that name-drops a suburb of Springfield.
  • Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind - I don't care what other people think of him, but I like Jim Carrey and I'm not afraid to admit it.
  • Good Bye, Lenin! - Very good movie. Highly recommended, especially if you know German.
  • Super Size Me - Speaking of which, I could really go for some McDonald's right about now.
  • In America - If anyone thinks that a game of carnival bean toss can't be suspenseful, they obviously haven't seen this movie.
  • Touching the Void - In my own humble opinion, this is the best recreated documentary-style film about mountain climbing that I've ever seen. Seriously though, excellent film.
  • Shrek 2 - Cat-nip. That's not mine! Ha ha ha!
  • A Very Long Engagement - I haven't actually seen this one yet, but I plan to next week... I've yet to dislike a movie with Audrey Tautou in it.
MUSIC ALBUMS I ENJOYED IN 2004 If it weren't for my more musically-inclined friends, I'd only like Bjork, Radiohead, Rufus Wainwright, and the Beatles. Thanks be to Justin, Allison, 89.1 FM, and iTunes recommendations for tuning me in and turning me on to many a great album that I otherwise would have never known existed. It should also be noted that while not all of these albums were released in 2004, that's when I first started listening to them, so that's why they're included.
  • Bjork - Medulla
  • Postal Service - Give Up
  • Ladytron - 604
  • Death Cab for Cutie - Tranatlanticism
  • Benny Benassi - Hypnotica
  • Franz Ferdinand - Franz Ferdinand
  • Emiliana Torrini - Love in the Time of Science
  • The Killers - Hot Fuss
  • Jem - Finally Woken
  • A Girl Called Eddy - A Girl Called Eddy
  • Reed Foehl - Spark
TV SHOWS I ENJOYED IN 2004
  • Arrested Development - I've said it before, and I'll say it again, this is probably the best comedy series on network television today.
  • The Amazing Race - Last season was good, but this season is lining up to be even better.
  • 24 - We Netflixed season 1 and 2 and watched them straight through in 2 weeks. Doesn't sound impressive? You try watching 48 hours worth of DVDs in 2 weeks time while holding down a full-time job!
  • The Apprentice - I like Donald Trump. Period. He's UGE!
  • Scrubs - We love this show, but it often gets preempted by the Amazing Race.
  • Survivor - All-Stars, NOT Vanuatu! Burnett's going to have to really pull something special out of his ass to save the franchise in the 10th season. We met Rupert once and Nicole has Big Tom's autograph!
BEERS I ENJOYED IN 2004 According to the BeerAdvocate.com (links provided), I drink some piss poor beers. Oh well.
  • Missouri Brown
  • Bud Light
  • Dos Equis
  • Good ole, plain jane, standard Budweiser
  • Pabst Blue Ribbon
  • Schlafly Oatmeal Stout
  • Amber Bock
  • Red Stripe
  • Corona without lime
  • Coors Light
CEREALS I ENJOYED IN 2004
  • Cheerios
  • Kix
  • Honey Bunches of Oats
  • Raisin Bran
  • Cocoa Pebbles
  • Fruity Pebbles
  • Cocoa Puffs
  • Trader Joe's Puffin Cereal
  • Frosted Mini Wheats
  • Trix
  • Sugar Smacks
  • Honeycomb
  • Corn Pops
OTHER STUFF I ENJOYED IN 2004
  • NETFLIX!
  • Trader Joe's
  • Trader Joe's Strawberry Fruit leather
  • MVP 2004 for PS2
  • Coppola Black Diamond Claret
  • Qdoba
  • Stir Crazy
  • Our "wanted by the FBI" neighbor finally moving last week!
  • Regular bowel movements... at least until we started this whole "theater" project.
There you have it, folks. The things that put a smile on my face over the last three hundred and sixty some days.
author: Dan

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: I love lists! Dan, you're at the top of my list of people I loved in 2004. Awwwwwww.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Awwwwwww. I've got a big kiss with your name written all over it!

comments.author: Fyse
comments.body: Yuck. Get a room.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Don't feel bad, Fyse. I've got one here with your name on it too!

comments.author: whitty
comments.body:
Only 4 of your "best movies" list came to Springfield, if that tells you how badly we need you.  Count this as my offical request for you to play the rest of the movies on your list. 

Didn't Shaun of the Dead come out on DVD last week?  And Napolean Dynamite this week?  Ooo, I know what I am getting for christmas!

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Whitty: Shaun of the Dead came out on DVD yesterday. We're buying it tonight! Fuckin' A!

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: And we're going to force Stephanie to watch it, and she'll have nightmares for MONTHS! Mwhahahaha!

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: Which were the four movies that came to Springfield? I can say for sure Bourne Supremecy and Shrek, because saw both of those there.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Mwha ha ha ha!

comments.author: Fyse
comments.body:
Ah, if only I could belive you Daniel. If only... (sob, sob)

Radiohead fan eh? I've seen them live twice, and I hope that makes you jealous. Are you a fan of their new stuff too? I like both incarnations, but I know a lot of people who don't.

There are some British versions of Netflix beginning to establish themselves, but in my current impoverished I haven't joined any of them yet. One day...

Oh, and you do drink terrible beer.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Fyse, I'll have you know that I TOO have seen Radiohead live twice. Once in Chicago on August 1, 2001 and again in St. Louis on August something, 2003. I'm also related to Thom and have slept with Bjork 4 times.

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: We've seen Radiohead live twice, too!

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Oh, AND we've seen Radiohead twice!

comments.author: Fyse
comments.body: You've seen Radiohead how many times?

comments.author: whitty
comments.body: Garden State and Napoleon Dynamite came to Spfld too.  Though Napoleon Dynamite came BRANSON first!  How does that make sense?  I actually drove to Branson to see Shaun of the Dead - totally worth it.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body:
Fyse: twice.

Whitty: After we open, you'll never have to drive to Branson again. I promise.

comments.author: Jasmine H.
comments.body:
Dan --
I'm a reporter for [omitted]. Please call me when you have a moment -- I'm interesting in putting together a piece about the new theater.
call [omitted] (m) or [omitted].
Jasmine H.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Uh oh. Perhaps I should've left out the bowel movement comment.

comments.author: einahpets
comments.body: I saw Shaun of the Dead and slept like a baby. Yup, zombie nightmares, good-bye. As long as I know I can keep them in the garage and play video games with them, then I feel a whole lot better about judgement day when the zombies come.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Yay! I'm glad you liked it.
